page.title: 19RENOVATING OLD HOUSES
page.content: Many of the houses in the area are very old; and renovating one's house is a popular occupation. Mr J.M.Jones bought an old house at Nooklane Head seven years ago and has been renovating it ever since. The house is made of New Red Sandstone and is approximately 300 years old. He has discovered some interesting things. While digging in the garden he unearthed the foundations of the previous house on the site (i.e. in a different position from the present house). He also found a peculiar shaped stone which he believes to be part of the roof of the orginal house. While he was installing a stove in his house he had to take out an old fireplace. Behind it he found another fireplace....and another: four blocked up fireplaces in all.
